intro: Cheiridopsis derenbergiana, commonly known as the Doringkop or "Ringhead" ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers range in color from yellow to orange, often appearing in late winter to early spring. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
